name: SeaCoast Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terri and Al are extremely knowledgeable; everything they recommended was spot-on - from the restaurants to the ferry times! I have been travelling on business for over 25 years and have yet to find the level of service that we experienced at the SeaCoast.
reviews.title: Five Diamond Service

likes.liked: — Terri and Al; Location of the motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is quiet and the rooms clean. The continental breakfast was abundant with cereals, bagels, Dunkin' Donuts, juice, coffee. Terri and Al also provide large trays if you care to take breakfast in your room.
reviews.title: 5 Star Concierge Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The small in-room kitchenette, with microwave and refrigerator, was a real plus when we wanted to heat up some leftovers from one of the many great restaurants nearby. And the utensils, plates and bowls were clean - no funky stuff! (Tip: bring your own paper towels or kitchen towel as there is no dishwasher)
reviews.title: Like staying with family!

likes.liked: — Terry and Al the most amazing hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel location is perfect. We walked to Main Street, Hyannis then hopped in the car to explore all the Cape has to offer such as bike riding on the Cape Cod Rail Trail in Eastham and hiking at Salt Pond.
reviews.title: Functional and Friendly

likes.disliked: — Not a place for views, but we knew that when we booked so can't complain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have found our perfect place on the Cape and hope to return soon and often. The SeaCoast is a real gem.
reviews.title: Great time in Cape Cod

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is so good, I am taking my parents this year (2007) to New England and we are staying for a longer time here.
reviews.title: The #1 hotel on Cape Cod

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were welcomed with a drink and you felt you had known the owners for years.
reviews.title: The Seacoast is #1 !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anything you needed to know, Terri new what was best. Where to go, all the areas tourists do not see, any maps and directions needed, what is worth doing and what isn't etc. etc.
reviews.title: Believe the Hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are staying on Cape Cod anytime, stay here. It is well located for all of Cape Cod and you can have a nice walk in the evening where it is located.
reviews.title: Ask about the bike route!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I just returned from a five day stay at the SeaCoast Inn. It was our first trip to the Cape and we booked the SeaCoast based on the reviews posted here on tripadvisor. I am so glad we did. Everything the reviews mention is 100% accurate. Our hosts, Terri and Al were incredible. They just seem to know exactly what their guests need. They made our stay absolutely wonderful from their dining recommendations (which were always great) to their consistant attention to detail from breakfast favorites (their breakfast is awesome) to beach towels, chairs and boogyboards!, to great locations around Hyannis and the Cape to even washing our clothes (and folding them!). I can't say enough about Terri and Al, they are phenomneal. They made it really hard for us to leave!
reviews.title: Super place !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: July 13,2007 Ron W Bridgeview,Il.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife & I just wished we had more time to spend at the Sea Coast Inn as Al & Terri were just wonderful hosts.
reviews.title: The Reviews are true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had steamship tickets, brochures, and other helpful advice
reviews.title: Wat a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: that you don't usually don't expect these days.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had injured my leg prior to arriving at the Sea Coast & Terri offered to drive us to the steamship for our trip to Nantuckett and she also provided beach chairs for our day at the beach.
reviews.title: great location

likes.liked: — was clean and close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here 20-23 August, and on arrival we were greeted by Al who upgraded us to a larger room which overlooked the park. He directed us to a great seafood restaurant a couple of blocks away where we had a lovely meal. The location of the property is excellent, with main street one block away with loads of restaurants, shops and the JFK Museum, and in the other direction was the harbour, a 10 minute walk to 2 different ferry terminals to Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard. Terri very kindly sorted us out with discounted tickets to both which was so convenient and saved us having to stand in line for them. She also booked tickets for a whalewatching trip from Provincetown for us. This was an amazing experience as we were lucky enough to see 8 hump backed whales. Al and Terri (as confirmed in other reviews) really do know how to make your stay special and how to look after their guests, they make you feel at home and always take time out to help with directions and advice. We would love to pay a return visit, we enjoyed our time touring round Cape Cod, and Hyannis was the perfect base to do this, so Al and Terri, hope to see you again one day as we are sure to return (apologies Al - he will be back to tease you some more !!!).
reviews.title: Great Location, excellent hosts and Dunkin' Donuts for breakfast !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed two nights at the Seacoast Inn. There is not much more I can add to the many glowing reviews already posted by other travelers except to say they are all accurate.
reviews.title: Comfortable Accomodations & A Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I'm really surprised that the rates are as low as they are considering their location. If you wish, as we did, to take a ferry to Nantucket or Martha's Vineyard you leave your car in their parking lot and walk about 8 minutes to the ferry terminal. The Inn also sells ferry tickets at a discount. By doing so you avoid paying a parking fee of $15 per day to park in the terminal parking lot.
reviews.title: If you like cape cod, your going to love the seacoast inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are more than pleased to provide any and all information you require: maps, guidebooks, photos, etc. You would be hard pressed to find people who are more friendly and hospitable than Terri & Al.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — That we had to leave and go home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We're already planning to return next year for a longer stay.
reviews.title: what fantastic people

likes.disliked: — No lounge area in evening or balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the SeaCoast Inn for 4 nights - it was wonderful. The owners are a great source of information about the area - we had no idea what we wanted to do and they provided us with information on places to go that lasted us our entire vacation! The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. The hotel was located close to the ferries to Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket and the drive to Provincetown is short. I would definitely recommend this hotel to Cape Cod visitors!
reviews.title: Great place with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent June 10, 2007 at the Seacoast Inn and we couldn't have found a better place. The owners, Al and Terri, are a lovely couple who treated us like friends. When I called to make the reservation, Terri was very friendly, and when we called to say we were arriving later than planned and needed directions, Al was more than happy to help us. The room was very clean, which is the only really important thing to me. There was a kitchenette with a microwave, small refrigerator and even dishes and silverware. (I forgot to take pictures, but you can see the rooms on their website.) The atmosphere is quiet, as they don't rent rooms to party types, and although I've never stayed at a B & B, it seemed a lot like what I would imagine one to be. A continental breakfast of assorted breads, juice, cereal, milk, coffee, etc. was included, and after that Terri gave us ideas of places to see and restaurants to eat at. (We drove to Chatham and ate lunch at the Chatham Squire, which was very good.) Unless you're looking for something more luxurious, just book the room and don't worry. It's clean and what more do you need? Our price was $68 for 2 queen beds and to me, that's a good deal.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable
great stay
reviews.text: fantastic stay. motel is in great location. the proprietors couldn't do enough. rooms were spotless and breakfast was ample and blissfully informal. [ideal with hangover] if your going to cape cod you could do a lot worse. will be returning and i don't normally go to same area twice never mind same digs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a basic motel but it is a great place to stay if you want an inexpensive, exceptionally clean motel with wonderful owners. And you can't beat the price, $78 a night! We loved the convenience of the efficiency kitchen and the beds were very comfortable. Our room had two beds--a double and a queen and it was fairly large. The bathroom was very clean. We had an end unit and our window looked onto the park--it was pretty and quiet. The continental breakfast was great (bagels, huge muffins, english muffins, cereal, and so on). The owners were incredibly helpful and give the place the feel of a B&B without being intrusive. They were also very accommodating; they drove some guests to the ferry and they kept breakfast open late for others. The location can't be beat. It's within an easy walk of the harbor and Main Street. I would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a great budget lodging for a weekend in Cape Cod. The owners greeted us warmly and were a font of information and help in planning our weekend. Their suggestions for meals, tours and sightseeing were most helpful and spot on, with very detailed maps and offers to make reservations for popular outings. The double room we booked was spotless and comfortable and included a small kitchenette and bar. The location in the middle of Cape Cod allowed us to visit many of the small towns and attractions on the cape in the course of the weekend. Additionally, the continental breakfast was fresh, appealling and better than most chain hotels. I have no reservations about making future reservations at the Sea Coast Inn!!
reviews.title: Great Bargain Digs! Amazing Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect Value for Money option with the added benefit of genuinely nice hosts who go out of their way to help out guests.
reviews.title: Perfect VFM in Hyannis with lovely hosts as bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, clean functional rooms with a basic continental breakfast thrown in.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to all the key relevant locations - ferry, harbor and the main street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
Great Cape Find, with Minor Caveats
reviews.text: Five stars - would recommend this place to everyone - except to those who want the Ritz @ $90 a night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: After refusing to check-in to our unacceptable timeshare deal, we drove up to Seacoast Inn to check it out as an alternative.
reviews.title: Awesome Birthday Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Well, the reviews here are accurate. From the point that I called the Inn, I had wonderful conversations with Terri. She also responded to an email asking for weekend activity ideas and had materials ready upon our arrival.
reviews.title: Superb service, will most definitely be back!

likes.disliked: — maybe that there was no pool (but beaches are close!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: You really couldn't ask for either a better location or better service. The rooms were comfortable, CLEAN, included small kitchen areas, and left nothing to be desired.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with plenty of coffee, muffins, bagels and Dunkin Donuts, cereal... The best part is that it ran until 10am, allowing late risers to still grab something in the morning.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to use the complimentary beach chairs and towels which are a very nice touch. The beaches are very close.
reviews.title: We Loved It!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend this as a perfect place to stay in Hyannis. You really couldn't do much better.
reviews.title: Exactly what it said on the tin...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only reason why I choose SeaCoast Inn was because of all the great reviews. So I had to see for myself if all they say about Terri and Al being fantastic hosts and the great location; minutes from the ferry, stores and restaurants and clean accommodation was all true. It’s all true! As soon as we check-in Terri and Al had our ferries reserved for Nantucket and Martha’s Vineyard and list of recommendation for restaurants. They are very knowledgeable about the island and so proficient and super friendly. The rooms were clean and you couldn’t ask for a better location. We had a fantastic time. O yeah, they also have free Internet in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay in Hyannis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the SeaCoast Inn for 6 nights in early September, and we had a wonderful vacation here. The property owners/managers, Al and Terri, are fantastic hosts. They make you feel like family and welcome you with open arms! As soon as we arrived, they were gracious enough to check us in quickly and offer us beverages after our long trip. They were an absolute wealth of information all week long, and they provided us with a large assortment of maps, dining guides, and even their own personal copy of a regional atlas that we could take with us on our travels around the Cape. They were very helpful with scheduling ferry trips and a whale watch cruise for us. Breakfast was simple but always fresh and filling, and they're quick to refill anything that runs out! Our best part of the trip was undoubtedly the meal that they generously offered to cook for us following our striper sportfishing adventure. We came home with 30 (?) lbs of striped bass, and they not only offered to fillet, package, freeze, and store it for us while we enjoyed our vacation, but one evening they even cooked it for us, along with some tasty side dishes! How great is that?!? You won't find that anywhere else! At the end of the week, they even packaged the frozen fish in a cooler for us to take home, along with giving us a nice little gift bag of mints for our return journey.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, excellent hosts!

likes.liked: — The hosts were excellent! Great service, and very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The SeaCoast Inn itself is a very nice little inn. We were upgraded free of charge to a nice king room on the end corner of the second floor facing a quiet park in the rear (room #27). This room was really excellent, and due to its location, I'd guess that it might be the nicest one on the property. It has large windows that can be opened in order to catch great breezes, and the suite was ALWAYS immaculately cleaned when we returned from a day of exploring the Cape. The inn is situated very close to the Hyannis Harbor and main street, so location could not be better. Really central to everything, but quiet and peaceful! It's not a luxery property, but it has absolutely everything that you need for a great vacation base, and the level of cleanliness, service, and friendliness is unsurpassed.
reviews.title: Exactly what the other reviews said

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously, the SeaCoast Inn exceeded all expectations (which were already pretty high considering the great reviews here), and we had a great trip thanks to Al and Terri. I'm sure if we visit the Cape again, we'll be returning here!
reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations - so delighted-we've added our review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We chose the SeaCoast Inn only because of the Trip Advisor strong recommendations. The personal service was exceptional; it was like having "Aunt Terry" fussing and caring and wanting you to have the best time possible. I knew from the reviews that the property itself was nothing great, but I was a bit surprised that it was nicer than I expected. I was expecting a Motel 6 bland room, but at least ours had a little more sparkle than I thought. Spacious and comfortable. If you don't need luxury and want good lodging at a nice price, this is the place to go on Cape Cod.
reviews.title: Great location, fantastic service and value for money

description: The SeaCoast Inn is in an excellent location for touring the Cape and the Islands, Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard. The ferries to the Islands, local Hyannis restaurants, shops and beaches are all within a short walking distance. We are family owned and operated and are knowledgeable about the surrounding area, sites and attractions. The facility is quiet and newly renovated with all non-smoking rooms. Most rooms have efficiencies. Continental breakfast is included.
